# Exercise 1 part b {.tabset}

First, the 100 sample values are obtained.

```{r, echo=TRUE}
s = log(rnorm(n=100, mean=1, sd=0.25))
```

The data is then plotted.

## Histogram

```{r, echo=FALSE}
hist(s, breaks=10, col="cornflowerblue",
    xlab="x",
    main="Log-normal distribution")
```

## Histogram on log-scale

```{r, echo=FALSE}
hist(exp(s), breaks=10, col="cornflowerblue",
    xlab="x",
    main="Log-normal distribution on the log scale")
```

#

## Parameters of the sample

- expected value: `r signif(mean(s), 3)`
- variance: `r signif(var(s), 3)`
